meanings.definition: A thick, flat piece of a hard material
meanings.sent1: The worker carried a heavy slab of wood.
meanings.sent2: The slab of metal was too heavy to lift.
meanings.sent3: The slab of chocolate looked too tempting to resist.
meanings.sent4: The slab of ice on the pond cracked under the weight of the skater.
meanings.sent5: The slab of rock jutted out from the cliff, casting a shadow below.

meanings.definition: A large, flat, thick piece of stone or concrete
meanings.sent1: The construction crew poured concrete to create a sturdy slab for the foundation.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins had a massive slab of stone marking the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The slab of concrete served as a makeshift stage for the impromptu performance.
meanings.sent4: The slab of marble gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The heavy slab of granite was carefully lowered into place by the crane.

meanings.definition: A flat, thick slice of meat or fish
meanings.sent1: The chef expertly sliced a slab of beef for the barbecue.
meanings.sent2: The market displayed a fresh slab of salmon on ice.
meanings.sent3: The slab of ham was so thick it barely fit between the slices of bread.
meanings.sent4: The slab of tuna was seared to perfection, leaving a mouthwatering aroma.
meanings.sent5: The slab of bacon sizzled in the pan, releasing a tantalizing scent.
